newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch closing share market report.
newsitem.headline: Dutch closing share market report.

text.p: Dutch shares held their ground on Thursday to close slightly higher despite a slip on Wall Street on renewed interest rate hike fears.
The AEX index closed up 0.65 points at 563.81, off the day's high of 565.86.
Dealers said the market was driven largely by options traders trying to keep the AEX below the key 565 point level ahead of tomorrow's options expiry.
"The market is already playing the game for tomorrow and the options expiry," one dealer said. "It looks like they want it to expire at this level."
Earlier in the session, the AEX dipped briefly on stronger than expected August German M3 money supply data, but soon gained ground in line with bonds.
Dealers were split on the prospects for the AEX. Some said the market looked increasingly nervous at these levels -- just nine points or so off its record high.
"Everybody is holding their positions, afraid to miss the move up," one dealer said. "But with everyone in, I wonder where the new cash to drive it higher will come from," he added.
A number of dealers were bullish on the index in the longer term, looking for it to hit 600 points by the end of the year.
A dearth of company news meant little in the way of individual company stock movements.
Unilever shares climbed to a new year high on what dealers said was strong buying interest from the U.S. and Asia.
"It could still be the switching from Heineken to Unilever story but volumes in Heineken are pretty low and those at Unilever fairly high," one dealer said.
The stock closed up 3.70 guilders at 269.10 after earlier reaching a new year high of 270.80.
